body:
@hyperxpro are the fields in question `sendSegmentNumber` and `receiveSegmentNumber`[1]? 

I see that we do not guard against integer overflow while accumulating bytes in these fields[2], perhaps we can do that before supporting larger payloads?

[1] https://github.com/netty/netty/blob/4.1/handler/src/main/java/io/netty/handler/pcap/PcapWriteHandler.java#L97-L103
[2] https://github.com/netty/netty/blob/4.1/handler/src/main/java/io/netty/handler/pcap/PcapWriteHandler.java#L284
Yes, we need to guard them against overflow. Norman did share swift-nio pcap where they fixed larger payloads and overflow. Lemme try to find it.

issue.title: Allow PcapWriteHandler instances to write to the same OutputStream

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

Currently, PcapWriteHandler expects a dedicated OutputStream, and cannot support multiple streams written to a single pcap file. These modifications are intended to support sharing the OutputStream between multiple concurrent PcapWriteHandler instances.

Modification:

Added a "shareOutputStream" flag to PcapWriteHandler (and PcapWriter) to enable synchronization on the OutputStream in order to prevent interleaved writes. Also provide a method to write the pcap Global Header to the OutputStream.

Result:

Allows multiple channels to write to the same pcap file.

issue.title: Allow PcapWriteHandler to output PCAP files larger than 2GB

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

PcapWriteHandler should be able to support large files but is currently limited to 2GB due to the usage of int without wrapping.

Modifications:

segmentNumber and ackNumber are now long values to support uint32 values. segmentNumber and ackNumber wrap around when the uint32 max is reached. Ported unit test from https://github.com/apple/swift-nio-extras/pull/85

Result:

Fixes #11543
